content:
Yes, there are several pop stars who have had a similar transition from gospel to pop. It's not uncommon for artists to begin their careers performing in church or gospel music before transitioning into secular music. Here are a few examples:

1. Whitney Houston - Whitney Houston got her start singing in church, and her gospel background heavily influenced her soulful, powerful voice. She later transitioned to pop music, becoming one of the most iconic voices of her generation.

2. Mariah Carey - Mariah Carey began her career singing background vocals for gospel artists before transitioning to pop music. Although her music is primarily secular, she has said that her gospel background continues to inspire and influence her.

3. Aretha Franklin - Aretha Franklin began her career singing gospel music in her father's church, and her gospel background is evident in her soulful, emotive singing style. She later transitioned to pop music, earning the title of "Queen of Soul."

4. Sam Cooke - Sam Cooke began his career as a gospel singer, and his gospel roots can be heard in his smooth, soulful voice. He later transitioned to pop music, becoming one of the most influential singers of the 1960s.

Overall, many pop stars have had a similar transition from gospel to pop, and it's clear that their gospel backgrounds have heavily influenced their music and style.
